title.narrative: OTP 5: ALL CHILDREN IN QUALITY LEARNING

description.narrative: By 2017, the government promotes full enrolment and retention of all children (3-15), especially most vulnerable, and applies new education standards for learning environments and outcomes.

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Moldova 131 31 August 1989 Street United Nations House Chisinau MD-2012

sector.narrative: Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, the government promotes full enrolment and retention of all children (3-15), especially most vulnerable, and applies new education standards for learning environments and outcomes.

description.narrative: Inclusive Education efforts brought further integration of children with disabilities and Roma children in mainstream schools and clear commitment was taken on the General Comment 4 to Article 24 of the CRPD. A per-capita financing formula for preschools is developed and will be piloted by the World Bank. | Status:Met | As-of Date:12/01/2018

title.narrative: Number of communities that have Roma segregated schools or classes
Percentage of educators trained on child centred methodology or inclusive education
Percentage of pupils competent in reading, mathematics and sciences (PISA report)

baseline.value: 43 % competent in reading, 39% in mathematics, 53% in sciences

target.value: 2017:10 percentage points increase in each of the three areas

actual.value:
2017:2015 PISA results
Reading 54,2% (11 p.p. increase) Maths 49,7% (10 p.p. increase) Science 57,8% (5 p.p. increase)
